PROPOSALS WERE REFERRED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR FURTHER STUDY.
All Board members were asked to present their very best ideas to this
GROUP SO THAT A CONCRETE PROPOSAL COULD BE SUBMITTED TO THE ENTIRE
MEMBERSHIP IN THE VERY NEAR FUTURE.
I LEFT THE CONVENTION AND THE BOARD MEETINGS WITH THE FEELING THAT
MEMBERS WERE MORE VOCAL AT THIS PARTICULAR MEETING. THEY EXPRESSED
THEIR WANTS IN A FORM THAT THE BOARD COULD TAKE ACTION ON. THE BOARD
NOW HAS TAKEN POSITIVE STEPS TO IMPLEMENT THEM. CERTAINLY A GREAT DEAL
OF GOOD SHOULD COME FROM THE PH ILADELPH 1 A.MEETING .
OF PARTICULAR INTEREST TO THE RADIO STATION OPERATORS WAS THE
APPROVAL IN PRINCIPAL OF THE NEW OPERATING MANUAL FOR THE NAEB NETWORK.
The RADIO BOARD AND THE FULL BOARD GAVE ADDITIONAL POLICY DIRECTIONS TO
THE DRAFTERS OF THIS DOCUMENT WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO SUBMIT IT BACK TO THE
FULL BOARD BY THE FIRST OF DECEMBER AND TO THE MEMBERSHIP BY THE FIRST
OF THE YEAR. A REVISED DRAFT WILL BE READY FOR PRESENTATION TO THE BOARD
AT ITS SPRING MEETING IN COLUMBUS IN THE SPRING. FINAL DISTRIBUTION
SHOULD BE MADE BY JULY I, 1963. THIS DOCUMENT SHOULD REGULARIZE ALL NET¬
WORK PROCEDURES AND SHOULD MAKE IT EXCEEDINGLY EASY FOR MANAGERS OF
STATIONS AFFILIATED WITH THE NETWORK TO UNDERSTAND THE OPERATION OF THIS
COMPLEX PIECE OF MACHINERY, AND TO ENABLE THEM TO TAKE THE BEST ADVANT¬
AGE OF THE SERVICES PROVIDED.
The main topic in the television area was whether NAEB should do any
PRODUCTION IN THE TELEVISION FIELD. At SEVERAL REGIONAL MEETINGS AND
AT THE TELEVISION STATION MANAGERS MEETING STRONG OPPOSITION WAS VOICED
TO THIS, BASED ON THE FEELING THAT ONE 0RGAN IZAT I 0N_IN THE EDUCATIONAL
TELEVISION PRODUCTION FIELD WAS ENOUGH, AND THAT NALB HAD A JOB TO DO TO
WORK FOR THE TELEVISION STATIONS IN AREAS OTHER THAN PRODUCTION, AND
THAT IT NEEDED TO SPEND MORE TIME IN DOING THIS JOB. OTHERS FELT THAT
NAEB HAD SPREAD ITSELF TOO THIN ATTEMPTING TO DO TOO MANY THINGS AND
THAT IT SHOULD GET SOME OF THESE JOBS DONE PRIOR TO STARTING OFF ON SOME
NEW APPROACH. THE BOARD AT ITS FINAL MEETING AMENDED ITS MOTION TAKEN
LAST May TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO DISCUSS ANY PROPOSAL FOR PROGRAM
PRODUCTION MADE TO HIM, TO CONSULT WITH THE TELEVISION STATION OPERATORS
REGARDING THESE PROPOSALS, AND TO SECURE APPROVAL OF THE FULL NAEB BOARD
BEFORE PROCEEDING TO IMPLEMENT THEM.
IF YOU HAVE ANY STRONG FEELINGS ABOUT ANY OF THE ABOVE MENTIONED
ITEMS MAY I URGE YOU TO WRITE TO D|CK HULL OR ME AT YOUR CONVENIENCE.
IF YOU ATTENDED IN PHILADELPHIA WE ARE GLAD YOU CAME AND HOPE YOU ENJOYED
YOURSELF AS MUCH AS WE DID. If YOU WERE UNABLE TO MAKE THIS MEETING WE
ARE SORRY YOU MISSED IT, AND HOPE SINCERELY THAT YOU WILL MAKE THE NEXT
ONE IN MlLWAKEE.
INCIDENTLY, YOU MIGHT CHALK DOWN EITHER AUSTIN, TEXAS, OR MEMPHIS,
Tennessee for the 1964 convention.
Dick Hull, Region III TV Director
Jim Miles, Region III Radio Director
